msgSnippet: ... I thought it does both. If not, try Castor, which is Java Bean  XML mapping. ... OK. ... That s true. A custom formatter. Someone needs to write Ant
messageBody:
Dennis N. Stetsenko wrote:

> I'm not familiar with Jakarta Commons Digester, but it seems like it was
> designed to make reverse (compare to my way) transformation: XML -> java
> objects.

I thought it does both. If not, try Castor, which is Java Bean <=> XML
mapping.

> I will inherit the idea of making snapshots of log file and screen from
> Netbean's Jelly, which is done by simply overriding <code>runBare</code>
> method.

OK.

> In general: I've found better solution. It is apparently possible to
> supply custom xml formatter for <junit> ant task using attributes like:
>
> <formatter classname="bla.bla.bla" extension=".xml" />.
>
> Unfortunately default implementation of it (class
> XMLJUnitResultFormatter.java) can not be easily extended for
> customization and is lacking some functionality. :-(
>
> So, I'm basically getting back to re-inventing the wheel, though I know
> for sure the shape now :-)

That's true. A custom formatter. Someone needs to write "Ant Cookbook".
:) (Hint: not I.)
